Misc data files for working with HUMAnN2 tools

For use with rename_table.py:
map_uniref50_name.txt.bz2: human-readable names for UniRef50 centroids
map_ko_name.txt.gz: human-readable names for KEGG Orthogroups (legacy function)

For use with regroup_table.py:
map_ko_uniref50.txt.gz: map UniRef50 centroids to KEGG Orthogroups
map_infogo1000_uniref50.txt.gz: map informative Gene Ontology subset to UniRef50 orthogroups (use --reverse flag)
map_transporter_uniref50.txt.gz: map MetaCyc transporters to UniRef50 orthogroups (use --reverse flag)


****************************************************************************************************************

EC mappings:
************
There are two EC mapping files:
1. EC to Uniref50s.  Example of a record in the file:
1.1.1.12	UniRef50_A2QAC0	UniRef50_B6HI95
The file name is  map_ECs_to_UniRef50.txt.gz

2. EC to (AC, UniRef50,UniRef90).....(AC, UniRef50,UniRef90)
The file name is map_ECs_to_AC_UniRef50_UniRef90.txt.gz
Example of a record in this file is as follows:
1.1.1.107	Q76KC2	UniRef50_Q76KC2	UniRef90_Q76KC2	Q988B7	UniRef50_Q988B7	UniRef90_Q988B7


These files are generated by the program  map_ECs_to_Uniref50_90.py
The command to generate the files for this program is:
 python map_ECs_to_Uniref50_90.py    --EnzymesFile  enzyme.dat --uniref50gz /n/huttenhower_lab/data/idmapping/map_uniprot_UniRef50.dat.gz --uniref90gz   /n/huttenhower_lab/data/idmapping/map_uniprot_UniRef90.dat.gz  --o_map1 Mapping_EC_AC_U5090s --o_map2 Map_ECs_U50


****************************************************************************************************************
